Our Team

Meet the board-certified neuroradiologists, neurologists, and neuropsychologists supporting Neuro Experts, PC.

Leadership

Every engagement is led by senior specialists with deep clinical and medico-legal experience. Below is the leadership profile along with full credentials, affiliations, and CV highlights.

Contact
info@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Affiliations: Harvard University, USC, UCLA Health, Veterans Affairs, Rancho Los Amigos.

Saman Hazany, MD, DABR

Radiology and Neuroradiology

Credentials

  • Board and CAQ certified in radiology and neuroradiology.
  • Harvard-trained neuroradiologist with DTI and concussion expertise.
  • 18+ years in academic neuroradiology leadership.

Affiliations

  • Chief of Neuroradiology, Greater Los Angeles VA Healthcare System.
  • Faculty appointments at UCLA and USC.
  • Former Chair and Director, Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center.

Bio

Award-winning, Harvard Trained Traumatic Brain and Spine Injury Imaging Expert and Chief of Neuroradiology at the Greater Los Angeles VA Healthcare System. Academic appointments at major academic centers (UCLA and USC) with a focus on Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) in concussion/mild TBI. Board and Certificate of Added Qualification (CAQ) in radiology and neuroradiology.

Extensive experience in the care of patients with traumatic brain and spine injury, stroke, epilepsy, and brain tumors. 18+ years of experience. Extensive teaching and research leadership experience at USC (2012- present) and UCLA (2019 – present).

Former Radiology department Chair and Director of Neuroradiology at Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center (2012-2018). CEO and chief neuroradiology expert witness at Neuro Experts, PC (2018-present), contributing to clinical care and medicolegal issues of numerous patients with neurological disorders. Frequent presenter and invited lecturer in neuroradiology and traumatic brain injury.

CV highlights

  • Academic appointments at USC (2012-present) and UCLA (2019-present).
  • Director of Neuroradiology at Rancho Los Amigos (2012-2018).
  • CEO and chief neuroradiology expert witness at Neuro Experts, PC (2018-present).
  • Frequent presenter and invited lecturer in neuroradiology and TBI imaging.

View full leadership profile

Clinical team

Neuro Experts, PC is supported by a multidisciplinary team of neurologists, neuropsychologists, and medical-legal specialists. Each profile includes credentials, affiliations, and a structured CV overview.

Contact
dbenmoshe@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Affiliations: Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Brain Science Research Institute.

Danny Benmoshe, MD

Neurology

Credentials

  • Diplomate, American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology.
  • MD, Albert Einstein College of Medicine (2005).
  • Residency and fellowship, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center.

Affiliations

  • Principal Investigator, Brain Science Research Institute.
  • Affiliated with Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.

Bio

Dr. Danny Benmoshe is a diplomat of the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology who practices in Los Angeles, California. He is the principal investigator for the Brain Science Research Institute.

Dr. Benmoshe specializes in treating all neurological conditions, including cognitive conditions such as mild traumatic brain injuries, Alzheimer’s disease, and other dementias. He also performs diagnostic tests, including EEG, EMG, and NCV. He is affiliated with Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.

He received his medical degree from Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva University in 2005 and did his residency and fellowship at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center. He is fluent in Spanish, Farsi, Hebrew, and English. He has received excellent ratings from his patients for his thoroughness, clarity, and ability to answer questions. He is also recognized as a top neurologist in Los Angeles and a leader in specialized neurological care and brain health.

CV highlights

  • Specializes in neurologic care for TBI, Alzheimer's disease, and dementias.
  • Clinical expertise in EEG, EMG, and NCV diagnostics.
  • Fluent in Spanish, Farsi, Hebrew, and English.
Contact
lsabbah@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Affiliations: Suffolk University, Harvard Medical School, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, California Rehabilitation Institute.

Liorah Sabbah, PhD

Neuropsychology

Credentials

  • PhD, Clinical Neuropsychology, Suffolk University (2018).
  • Internship, Boston VA Healthcare System - Harvard Medical School.
  • Fellowship and advanced TBI training, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.

Affiliations

  • Associate Director of Clinical Training, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.
  • Clinical affiliation, California Rehabilitation Institute.

Bio

Dr. Liorah Sabbah, PhD, is a clinical neuropsychologist who practices in Los Angeles, California. Dr. Sabbah specializes in evaluating adults and older adults with neurological and medical challenges, including dementia, traumatic brain injury, functional neurological disorders, and complex psychiatric presentations.

She also provides psychotherapeutic interventions, helping individuals optimize cognitive performance and maintain quality of life as they age.

She holds an associate director of clinical training position at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and an affiliation at California Rehabilitation Institute in inpatient rehabilitation. She received her doctorate degree from Suffolk University in 2018. She completed her internship at the Boston VA Healthcare System – Harvard Medical School program and her fellowship at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, followed by advanced fellowship training in TBI.

She is fluent in French and English. Dr. Sabbah’s approach is grounded in empathy and compassion, creating a supportive space for growth, healing, and resilience.

CV highlights

  • Specializes in neuropsychological evaluation of TBI and neurodegenerative disease.
  • Provides therapy to support cognitive performance and aging resilience.
  • Fluent in French and English.
Contact
dfenton@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Affiliations: California School of Professional Psychology, Iowa City VA, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, California Rehabilitation Institute.

Daniel Fenton, PhD

Neuropsychology

Credentials

  • PhD, Clinical Psychology (Neuropsychology), California School of Professional Psychology.
  • Internship, Iowa City VA Healthcare System.
  • Fellowship, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and advanced training in brain injury.

Affiliations

  • Fellowship training, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.
  • Specialized training, California Rehabilitation Institute.

Bio

Dr. Daniel Fenton, PhD, is a clinical neuropsychologist based in Los Angeles, California. Dr. Fenton specializes in the assessment and treatment of individuals with brain injury, cognitive effects of trauma and emotional injury, and various forms of dementia.

He earned his doctorate in clinical psychology with a concentration in neuropsychology from the California School of Professional Psychology. He completed his internship in neuropsychology at the Iowa City VA Healthcare System, followed by advanced fellowship training at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and additional specialized training in brain injury at California Rehabilitation Institute.

In addition to his clinical practice, Dr. Fenton has provided expert consultation in legal and forensic contexts, assisting numerous attorneys and law firms in achieving favorable case outcomes. His approach integrates scientific precision with compassion, helping clients regain clarity, resilience, and cognitive strength.

CV highlights

  • Clinical focus on cognitive rehabilitation and brain injury recovery.
  • Expert consultation for attorneys and legal teams in complex cases.
  • Advanced fellowship training in neuropsychology and brain injury.
Contact
nbashardoust@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Affiliations: USC Keck School of Medicine, USC, Neuro Experts.

Nusha Bashardoust

Physician Assistant, Neurology and Emergency Medicine

Credentials

  • Master of Physician Assistant Practice, USC Keck School of Medicine.
  • Bachelor's in Health Promotion and Disease Prevention.
  • Medical-legal evaluation experience (IME, QME, AME).

Affiliations

  • Clinical experience in Emergency Medicine and Dermatology.
  • Collaborates with dermatology specialists for medical-legal assessments.

Bio

Nusha Bashardoust has been a devoted healthcare provider since 2014, bringing extensive experience in both Emergency Medicine and Dermatology, where she assists with medical-legal evaluations. She obtained her Bachelor’s in Health Promotion and Disease Prevention and her Master of Physician Assistant Practice from the USC Keck School of Medicine, building a strong foundation in evidence-based, patient-centered care.

Her interest in neurology began in the emergency department, where she managed acute neurological cases and saw the significant impact neurological disorders have on patients. This passion led her to transition into neurology, where she now focuses on medical review and evaluation.

Alongside her clinical roles, Nusha has collaborated closely with a Dermatology physician on medical-legal assessments, including Independent Medical Examinations (IMEs), Qualified Medical Evaluations (QMEs), and Agreed Medical Evaluations (AMEs). Known for her analytical skills, attention to detail, and compassionate care, she continues to advance neurological assessment and patient care.

CV highlights

  • Manages acute neurological cases and medical review workflows.
  • Supports independent medical evaluations across multiple specialties.
  • Known for analytical rigor, attention to detail, and compassionate care.
Contact

Bio

Sandra Bolando is an experienced executive professional with a strong background in office administration and leadership support. She is dedicated to maintaining efficient operations and providing exceptional organizational assistance to executive teams.

CV highlights
